job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Fayetteville, AR
pros: Agency covers huge part of the state, resources, variety of programs
cons: Being so Spread out can cause more limited communication

pros: plenty of work, high case load

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Springdale, AR
cons: There is so much paper work

job_title: Mental Health Professional in Fayetteville, AR
pros: Free note pads, responsive upper management to emails/issues.
cons: Focus on billing, very little focus on quality of care or training on quality of care. Giant mental health conglomerate focused on keeping the lights on. We were forced to take PTO during the pandemic.

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Springdale, AR
pros: Generous opportunities to practice different modes of therapy (play, depth psychotherapy, group, family, etc.).
cons: High expectations regarding children seen per day. Support depends on school placement.

pros: Decent learning experience here at OGC
Free supervision is a plus to working here.

- Incredibly rewarding work
- Never work overtime
- Consistent hours and workloads
- Fantastic coworkers (I worked in TDT, which was by far the best area)
- Build genuine connections with your coworkers and clients/students
- If you want to be a therapist, DO THIS FIRST! It is great hands-on experience of what therapy is like
cons:
- Low pay for the work they have you doing
- Not enough recognition of the hard work QBHP's along with therapists put in
- Can be a very stressful job since you are working with students who need a lot of help and assistance

review_title: Great community work but unfortunate work culture
pros: Working with families, children, and therapists, and hopefully making a positive impact in clients' lives. Medical benefits were decent but not great.
cons: Poor compensation, poor management, poor leadership, no raises, no career advancement opportunities, and weird office culture.

pros: Good trainings for employees for continuing education
cons: Poor management personnel. Most managers are on power trips and run off good employees by harassing, singling out, and putting peers against peers.

pros: great coworkers and clients, m-f schedule
cons: pay is not great for master's degree

job_title: Behavioral Health Counselor in Springdale, AR

pros: The clients/patients are in need of help.
cons: Hired for one job which changed after 3 1/2 weeks.  Then changed again after 5 weeks, and kept on changing.  While my skills are recognized, they seem to be used as an excuse.  There does not seem to be a plan for the overall business.  Just because a place is non profit/not for profit does not mean that they should not have a plan.  Perhaps a plan that is grounded from the roots up, not the top down.

review_title: I work with children with emotional and behavioral disorders in an educational setting.
job_title: Mental Health Paraprofessional (Clinical) in Springdale, AR
pros: My coworkers are friendly, hard-working, team-oriented people. Immediate supervisor is helpful and does not micromanage. We get school breaks off with pay. Health insurance premiums are not expensive.
cons: Upper management is very unsupportive. The pay isn't great. High-deductible insurance. Unreasonable performance expectations. They use productivity requirements and staff shortages to deny use of paid time off. You cannot take vacation or mental health days EVER, and it effects morale and client care. Very stressful environment. Require 30 days notice to resign and threaten not to pay out unused PTO if this expectation is not met. Productivity is based on how many Medicaid hours you bill, and you are expected to make up productivity for holidays, in-service days, sick days, training days with no kids, etc. Don't  work there!

pros: The people are nice and will try to help you if you're in a bind.
cons:
Productivity is a big push on reaching your hours but it's pretty difficult based on the school you're at.
Often times it feels like you don't know what you're supposed to be doing in the job to be beneficial to the children
Bonuses are hard to earn and are based on productivity

job_title: Mental Health Professional in Springdale, AR
pros: OGC pays for supervision for those needing to obtain their LCSW certification (which is great).  There's also a bunch of different departments so there are various populations you can work with.  It's been a good experience for the most part.
cons: The pay is decent but it isn't as competitive as it should be.  Also... meeting productivity is frustrating each week.

review_title: Hourly staff does not get raises
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Bentonville, AR
pros: Working the front desk is easy and laid back. I made lifelong friends. Great work life balance with great PTO and holiday pay.
cons: There is no room for advancement. You won’t get a raise. They don’t do raises. In years they gave one fifty cent raise.

pros: The intrinsic rewards you get from helping your clients.
cons: Horrible company to work for. HR is a nightmare, awful pay, will never get raises regardless of work history or effort, constantly micro managed, unappreciated, and overworked.
